intro: Ocotea palmana, commonly known as the white sand ocotea, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface, while its bark is smooth and often reddish in color. Ocotea palmana is often found in moist, well-drained soils within forest understories.
